findings.title: Non-compete / non-solicit style restriction
findings.rationale: Restrictive covenants can limit future business activity; enforceability varies and is commonly negotiated.

ense to use all work product created during employment for Employer's business purposes.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE
Confidentiality obligations survive termination and continue for 3 years.

5. NON-COMPETE AND NON-SOLICITATION

findings.title: Short termination or notice windows
findings.rationale: Short or strict notice windows can lead to accidental renewals or unintended termination.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...6. TERM AND TERMINATION Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice....
findings.context:
ue for 3 years.

5. NON-COMPETE AND NON-SOLICITATION
Employee may not compete within the same industry for 1 year after termination, within Employer's service area.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice.

7. INDEMNIFICATION
Mutual indemnification: each party indemnifies the other for its own negligence, capped at annual compensation.

8. DISPUTE RES

findings.title: Specific governing law or venue
findings.rationale: Governing law and venue choices can affect enforcement cost and strategy.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...10. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement is governed by Georgia state law....
findings.context:
e, capped at annual compensation.

8. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
Disputes shall be resolved through good faith negotiation.

9. ATTORNEYS' FEES
Each party bears its own legal costs.

10. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement is governed by Georgia state law.

This Agreement is effective as of January 1, 2025.

changes: Added 8 high-signal rules (attorneys fees, liability cap carveouts, assignment restrictions, etc.)
Implemented clause-level anchoring and false-positive suppression
